blocks.name: OPTIONS
blocks.description: Options for the structured grid, including spatial reference and units.

variables.name: LENGTH_UNITS
variables.description: Length units used for the model grid and all spatial data.
variables.tooltip: Specifies the length units for all spatial dimensions in the model. Must be consistent with all input data including hydraulic conductivity and boundary conditions.

variables.name: NOGRB
variables.description: Keyword to deactivate writing of the binary grid file.
variables.tooltip: When specified, the binary grid (GRB) file is not written. The GRB file contains grid connectivity information used by post-processing tools. Omitting it saves disk space but limits post-processing.

variables.name: XORIGIN
variables.description: X-coordinate of the origin of the model grid, in the length units specified.
variables.tooltip: The x-coordinate of the lower-left corner of the model grid in a real-world coordinate system. Used for spatial referencing and GIS integration. Default is 0.0.

variables.name: YORIGIN
variables.description: Y-coordinate of the origin of the model grid, in the length units specified.
variables.tooltip: The y-coordinate of the lower-left corner of the model grid in a real-world coordinate system. Used for spatial referencing and GIS integration. Default is 0.0.

variables.name: ANGROT
variables.description: Counter-clockwise rotation angle of the model grid about the origin, in degrees.
variables.tooltip: Rotates the grid around the origin point. A positive value rotates counter-clockwise. Used when the model grid is not aligned with the coordinate system axes. Default is 0.0.

blocks.name: DIMENSIONS
blocks.description: Grid dimensions defining the number of layers, rows, and columns.

variables.name: NLAY
variables.description: Number of layers in the model grid.
variables.tooltip: Defines the vertical discretization. Each layer can have different properties. Layers are numbered from top (1) to bottom (NLAY).

variables.name: NROW
variables.description: Number of rows in the model grid.
variables.tooltip: Defines the number of rows in the structured grid. Rows are numbered from the top (north) edge of the grid (row 1) to the bottom (south) edge.

variables.name: NCOL
variables.description: Number of columns in the model grid.
variables.tooltip: Defines the number of columns in the structured grid. Columns are numbered from the left (west) edge of the grid (column 1) to the right (east) edge.

blocks.name: GRIDDATA
blocks.description: Grid geometry data defining cell sizes and elevations.

variables.name: DELR
variables.description: Column spacing along rows, an array of size NCOL.
variables.tooltip: Width of each column in the row direction. Can be a single value (uniform spacing) or an array of NCOL values for variable spacing. Units are the specified LENGTH_UNITS.

variables.name: DELC
variables.description: Row spacing along columns, an array of size NROW.
variables.tooltip: Width of each row in the column direction. Can be a single value (uniform spacing) or an array of NROW values for variable spacing. Units are the specified LENGTH_UNITS.

variables.name: TOP
variables.description: Top elevation of the first model layer, a 2D array of size NROW by NCOL.
variables.tooltip: Elevation of the top of layer 1. For layer 1 cells, this defines the upper boundary. Typically represents the land surface or top of the aquifer system.

variables.name: BOTM
variables.description: Bottom elevation for each model layer, a 3D array of size NLAY by NROW by NCOL.
variables.tooltip: Bottom elevation of each cell. BOTM for layer k also serves as the top of layer k+1. Must be less than the top elevation for each cell.

variables.name: IDOMAIN
variables.description: Integer array indicating active (1), inactive (0), or vertical pass-through (-1) cells.
variables.tooltip: Controls which cells are active. 1 = active (simulated), 0 = inactive (excluded), -1 = vertical pass-through (flow passes through but no equation solved). Default is 1 for all cells.
